original: Jansson, Oskar Bertil Petrus, handelslärare, aukt. revisor, Norrköping, f. 29/6/98 i Jönköp. av urfabr. Olof J. o. Matilda Persson. G. 26 m. Mai Isacsson. Barn: Marie-Louise f. 27, Olov 30, Lars 38. — Ex. v. Örebro hand:gymn. 22, DHS 24, YPCA hand:-lär :kurs 26, prakt, utbildn. i grosshand:- o. ind:föret. Delt. i idr:res. t. FinL, Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Belg., HolL, Frankr. o. Engl. Lär. v. Örebro h. folksk. 24-25, Örebro prakt, språk-o. hand:sk. 25, Bar-Lock-Inst. i Sthlm 27, lieiktor i hand :tekn. v. Norrköp. hand:gymn. sed. 28. Av hand:kamm. aukt. rev. 3il, led. av Norrköp. tax:nd 29-36, ordf. i tax:ndn f. aktiebol :distr. i Norrköp. 37 o. 38. På sin tid fram-g:rik allroundidr :man o. vårt lands första kulstötare av internat. klass (personl. rek. bästa hand 15,08 m. 27, sammani. 27,91 m. 21). Örebro SK förtj :GM, Sv. idr:förb. hed:t. o. stip:-Gm.
translated: Jansson, Oskar Bertil Petrus, commercial teacher, authorized accountant, Norrköping, born on June 29, 1898 in Jönköping to clockmaker Olof J. and Matilda Persson. Married on May 26 to Mai Isacsson. Children: Marie-Louise born in 1927, Olov in 1930, Lars in 1938. He graduated from Örebro commercial gymnasium in 1922, from DHS in 1924, and attended YPCA commercial teacher's course in 1926. He received practical training in wholesale and industrial companies and participated in sports trips to Finland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, Belgium, Holland, France and England. He was a teacher at Örebro elementary school from 1924-25, Örebro practical language and commercial school from 1925, at Bar-Lock-Institute in Stockholm in 1927, and a lecturer in commercial technology at Norrköping commercial gymnasium since 1928. He was an authorized accountant for the Chamber of Commerce since 1931, a member of Norrköping tax commission from 1929-36, chairman of the tax committee for the stock district in Norrköping in 1937 and 1938. He was a successful all-round sportsman and our country's first internationally-class shot-putter (personal record best 15.08 m. in 1927, combined 27.91 m. in 1921). He was awarded deserved recognition by the Örebro Sports Club, the Swedish Sports Federation, and scholarships.
